title: What is an Online Library?
text: An online library is a digital repository providing access to books, research papers, journals, and other resources over the internet. It allows users to find and read materials without having to visit a physical location. Why might this benefit someone who travels a lot?

title: Advantages of Remote Access
text: Remote access allows individuals to read and download library materials from anywhere with an internet connection. How does this advantage apply to someone who is frequently on the move, like Margot?

title: Public Domain Books and Online Libraries
text: Public domain books are works whose exclusive intellectual property rights have expired or are inapplicable. While online libraries may have public domain books, they often provide access to a wider variety of materials, including newer works. How might this range of options be relevant to Margot's work?
